intro: Lespedeza uekii, commonly known as the Japanese bush clover, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Lespedeza uekii is often found in forest understories and along stream banks, where it plays a role in soil stabilization and provides nectar for pollinators. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three small, oval-shaped leaflets.
